course.subject: ENVS
course.name: Introduction to Ocean Science
course.description: The ocean defines the features of our planet. The ultimate goal of the course is to promote and enhance ocean literacy, which means the awareness and understanding of fundamental concepts of the history, functioning, and utilization of the ocean. By the end of this course students will understand the ocean's influence on individuals and their influence on the ocean. The course will cover a wide range of topics including ocean physics, marine chemistry, marine geology, and biological oceanography.
course.prerequisites: LIFS 1030 OR PHYS 1003

reviews.author: Jiehua
reviews.title: OCES2001 Survey of Ocean Science
reviews.comment_content:
Big picture: ocean as part of the Earth system. 􏰁 Physical oceanography.

Prof LIU: Not good accent, perform normal
Prof Wang: responsible and kind
Alex: speaking too fast and hard to catch his word. On online teaching mode, only student who attend the class can get lecture video. PPTs are messy and full of a lot of content

reviews.author: HashireKinoko
reviews.title: Do not ask for too much, it's what it is
reviews.comment_content:
Interesting, informative but rather general, more tilted towards biological topics

Prof. Chan's part: (September)
1. Introducing Ocean Science
2. Hydrologic cycle
3. Plate tectonics
4. Plate tectonics and Ocean basins
5. Ocean sediments
6. Deep sea biology
7. Hydrothermal vents and cold seeps

Prof. Liu's part: (October onwards)
8. Air-sea interactions
9. Surface circulation
10. Physical properties of seawater
11. Thermohaline circulation
12. Waves

-----Midterm exam (1-12)-----

13. Tides
14. Coastal processes
15. Ocean chemistry
16. Introduction to phytoplankton
17. Phytoplankton and primary production
18. Geographical variations on primary production and     Introduction to zooplankton I
19. Introduction to zooplankton II
20. Fisheries oceanography
21. Introduction to marine bacteria and archaea
22. Introduction to marine virus
23. Microbial loop
24. Marine resources and environmental concerns

-----Final exam (13-24)-----

No more field trip this semester
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof.Chan, as usual, teaching and explaining everything very well and fluently. She would show interesting videos about the topics and ask for our questions to address, sad that she is leaving :(

Oh for Arh.Liu, he is also quite nice but sometimes he speaks too soft, and would make some catastrophic assumptions that we knew how to interpret his research findings with random graphs and equations come from nowhere. And unfortunately, most of those content don't even relate to exams nor the course plan.
reviews.comment_grading:
The exam policy is likely to be adjusted
50% midterm (MCQ + 4SQ, 1 lecture long)
50% final（cheatsheet, all LQ, 3 hours allowed)

Exam questions are mostly straight forward, the slides from Prof.Chan (and her tips :) ) and the textbook are enough to handle the midterm, more than sufficient time was allowed.

Mean:31, Sd: 6.1, Maximun: 43 (out of 50)

For the final exam, the parts related to planktons and microbiology were taught by Prof.Liu, he likes to use his own or others' research as part of the teaching material, yet those are not necessary for the exam, only main concepts/features are important.

Got >0.5 sd in mt, >1.5 sd in final , grade A- at the end, so I guess the grading is normal but worth studying hard.
reviews.comment_workload:
Just the cheatsheet, which Arh.liu is not quite happy about

That really makes up the workload as most questions do not actually require the cheatsheet to answer (not like those stupid things in PHYS1003) as the topics are very understandable and the exams were not even meant to be tough.

reviews.author: Penguino585
reviews.comment_content:
The ocean defines the features of our planet. The ultimate goal of the course is to promote and
enhance ocean literacy. Ocean literacy refers to the awareness and understanding of fundamental
concepts of the history, functioning, and utilization of the ocean. Students should become ocean
literate individuals at the end of this class, meaning that you understand the ocean’s influence on you
and your influence on the ocean. Ocean science is a highly interdisciplinary subject. We will cover a
wide range of topics including ocean physics, marine geology, marine chemistry, and biological
oceanography. This course will consist of lectures, inquiry-based activities, and group discussions.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Chan is very engaging and excited about the topic. However, she only is teaching only a few lectures and Professor. Liu taught the rest.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term exam 40%
Final exam 50%
In class participation 5%
Field trip report 5%

Final isn't cumulative, but what you learn during the first half of the semester is still important
reviews.comment_workload: There is a textbook and reading that is assigned, but the use of the textbook is not necessary. Overall, besides the paper, there is not too much to do.
